thread.title: Muslims blast 'boozy' Eastenders: Characters are Queen Vic Regulars
thread.title_full: Muslims blast 'boozy' Eastenders: Characters are Queen Vic Regulars

title: Muslims blast 'boozy' Eastenders: Characters are Queen Vic Regulars

persons.name: davood ghadami  student saleema farah burney

text:
PUB REGULAR: Kush Kazemi, played by actor Davood Ghadami 
Student Saleema Farah Burney said many Muslim women were angry at the BBC soap. 
Drinking alcohol is forbidden by the Koran, but the programme has shown characters such as postman Masood Ahmed, played by actor Nitin Ganatra, and Kush Kazemi, played by Davood Ghadami, regularly in the Queen Vic. 
GETTY FORBIDDEN: The Koran does not allow drinking alcohol 
Saleema, who interviewed Muslim women across the south east as part of her PhD, said they believed television’s portrayals of religious rule-breaking were harmful to integration. 
She told the British Islam conference, in London, many women believed the lack of positive role models contributed to a toxic split between British Muslims and non-Muslims. 
A spokesman for the BBC soap said: “EastEnders is a fictional drama and has a rich history of representing a diverse range of religions and beliefs.” Related articles
